title: BUTTER label script logo
content:
Looking for an ID on the script font that spells out ’Butter’ in red.

many thanks in advance

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091113083920im_/http:/typophile.com/files/letterpress_cards_2_3758.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [letterpress\_cards\_2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20091113083920/http:/typophile.com/files/letterpress_cards_2.jpg) | 88.28 KB |
author: SKUMATIK

comments.content:
I think that’s a custom lettering job. The way the B swash crosses the t’s is not likely to happen in a font.

- Mike Yanega

Here is a link to the designer (Luke Dorny) along with insight into it’s development.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/luxuryluke/sets/72157594559604715/](http://web.archive.org/web/20091113083920/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/luxuryluke/sets/72157594559604715/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/luxuryluke/sets/72157594559604715/")

@SKUMATIK, I should have been more clear.  
Yes, that was all custom Illustrator work by me for my business [http://butterlabel.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20091113083920/http:/butterlabel.com/), and the site should launch officially “shortly”.

The “LABEL” underneath is a massaging of [Mark Simonson](http://web.archive.org/web/20091113083920/http:/typophile.com/user/1043)’s [Mostra](http://web.archive.org/web/20091113083920/http:/www.ms-studio.com/FontSales/mostra.html) typeface, which is beautiful. This was made before he relaunched Mostra as an OpenType face. Need to upgrade.

Also, Berthold’s Akzidenz Grotesk on the flip side. The Light with Oldstyle Figures is snappy.
hey thank you all so very much!
